txt.en: 'Good, they seem to have given up their pursuit. I think we are finally safe...for now.'
'Let us return to Echad Dagoras. I would not want to deny Braigiar his chance to ridicule me for allowing myself to be captured.'
'There is no time to waste! Let us depart.'
'Ah! It is good to be out in the open air again, but let us not tarry. The others will soon realize that something is wrong.'
Speak with Dagoras and find a way to release him from his cell.
Dagoras has made it to the cave exit
Find the key to Dagoras' cell in the jailor's quarters.
'Ah, that is better. It was rather cramped in there.'
Find the key to Dagoras' cell in the jailor's quarters.
Escape from Lhe Lhechu with Dagoras.
Escape from Lhe Lhechu with Dagoras.
'Huh? What? What do you think you're doing in here?'
Find the key to Dagoras' cell
Escape from Lhe Lhechu with Dagoras
Protect Dagoras as you make your escape

Braigiar believes that his captain, Dagoras, has been captured by the Dunlending deserters after going to negotiate an agreement with them. He has asked you to try to find and rescue Dagoras from Lhe Lhechu.
'My arm is getting sore, and we are not out of this yet...let us head outside.'
'Well done...now let us be off quickly!'

'Listen carefully now: the guard who carries the key to this cell usually sleeps in the next room.

'You should be able to sneak in there and find the key -- or if necessary just relieve him of it personally.

'Try not to make too much noise though: this cell is small, and I do not have room for a lot of company here.'
